author: m.kalinin
content: Interesting, I guess the relation is unstable due to low participation rate on ropsten which leads to delays in finality and missed slots. It should be much more stable on mainnet

author: hdxhaha
content: Hello, I joined goerli testnet 2.0 merge, but I found all method return "method eth_getFilterChanges does not exist/is not available", any pointer to solve this is highly appreciated.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Ya here's the last 4h of Ropsten and Sepolia side-by-side, Sepolia looks to be a bit more stable:

author: m.kalinin
content: Assuming no empty slots and participation rate high enough to justify each epoch, the diff should be in `[64; 95]` range. 64 is after the first block in the epoch is processed, 95 is after the last one

author: ryanleeschneider
content: So would the fact that the diff seems to bottom out around mid-to-upper 40s instead of 64 imply that roughly 14/64 slots are empty?  That might be another interesting metric to watch, do any of the CLs already capture that?

author: ryanleeschneider
content: I just did a quick logs scan of a ropsten teku node and in the last hour 93 of 300 slots were empty, so roughly 30% but would be interesting to have that as a metric (I didn't see it when scanning existing teku metrics)

author: dirigible6945
content: What time is Bellatrix for Prater?

author: ralexstokes
content: > Bellatrix, the Prater upgrade readying it for The Merge will happen at epoch 112260, expected at 12:24PM UTC on August 4, 2022.

author: ajsutton
content: I think you want `beacon_slot{instance=~"$system"} - (beacon_finalized_epoch{instance=~"$system"} * 32)` Though that's number of slots, not number of blocks. The CL side doesn't track how many empty slots there have been recently - best you could do is how many slots since the last block.
